title: Why am i so bad at LoL?
body:
First of all, I'm not even sure if this is the right thread to post in ect. but i dont know where else to turn.

Ok so im a player of league of legends and i have been since i believe early season 3 i cant remember (A Long Time)
Anyway i feel like i still play quite bad dispite playing this game for so long. I have only about 800 wins in normal  and i feel like i still play like someone who's like lvl 20. I don't have much knowledge of the things i should from playing as long as i should. For example when i should build certain items and when i should do different things. I don't know how to freeze a lane or do a lot of mechanical stuff in game. I really need some help because i feel like i'm  a quite bad player for my playtime. Please, some help would be appreciated. I really need to learn these things. I have friends who started playing a long time after me and still proceed to always play better than me and have a lot more knowledge of different things. 

I apologise if this doesn't make much sense or it's hard to understand. 

Thanks in advance.

replies.body:
I'll help you, my friend. I'm very good at the game.

1. It's never your fault. If you're an ADC, it's the supports fault for not giving their own life for you. You, as the ADC, are more important than them.
2. If you get ganked and die, blame the support for not warding, despite the fact you still have your trinket. You're not a support, you don't ward.
3. If you're midlane and you die, it's the junglers fault.
4. If you're the jungler and you die, it's top/mid/bots fault as they should have helped you. They need your ganks so they should flash into that Jinx ult because you overstayed.
5. If you're toplane and you die, don't cry about it. Simply /all report my jungler, useless. Thanks.

If you lose the game, don't be upset. Sometimes it's not possible to carry those animals and you lose some games. It's not your fault.

highly recommend watching this series!

Created by students from University of New South Wales. It has a lot of great tips about aspects around league of legends which aren't as obvious. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iko2tqmDpJQ&list=PL9RdXhXESRJzgY_SwHB8T-cZxXljWhQvz
These are sooo good thanks Maraudaur!
It's because Oddjob was never good outside of N64 Goldeneye.
someone has to be bad at lol. you got the short straw.

Would you be interested in watching a Diamond 2 player smurf on a lower elo account? I feel watching good players in lower elos helps people see what they need to take advantage of. Also, because I will be playing at a lower elo, I can take the time to explain and educate you on the way.

Are you interested in watching me stream, while I smurf?

Watch youtube bro! Watch the pros. Just like anything in life. Open your mind to learning. Accept the fact that you're shit and empty your cup of water.. So you can fill it with raw information. Watch the professionals too! Jump on twitch and watch em
Don't die, Don't complain in chat and win lane. It worked for me and now im a wood 5 scrub lord that sucks logs

Yep this game isnt easy. Either u have to have a great intelligence to play jg or sup or have a pedator like instinct to play ad or mid. U should stick to a couple of champs matching ur skill cap and watch solo q plays of them in youtube. Op.gg is a great site to give u best build rune and masteries for each champs.

Master 3 champs in each role, and only count the mastery if you got positive at least 65% of the time

Learn your counters, and how you can push your champs to the brink, as a thresh main i know how long i can stay in a fight even as my health goes down and will win the fight because i know the limits

get a coach to train you personally
find (at least) a champ to master
watch the videos of how professional player who mains your champ play the game
Win!
